pageTitle: Itinerary for Wednesday, November 7, 2018 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Ottawa, Ontario

10:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will attend the National Caucus meeting.  

12:45 p.m. The Prime Minister will meet with Ana Maria Gordon, the only surviving Canadian passenger of the MS St. Louis.

Prime Minister’s Office
Centre Block
Parliament Hill

Note for media:

    • Pooled photo opportunity at the beginning of the meeting                    

2:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend Question Period.

3:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will make a formal apology in the House of Commons over the fate of the MS St. Louis and its passengers.

6:15 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend a reception following the formal apology in the House of Commons, and will deliver brief remarks.

Room 100, First Floor
Sir John A. Macdonald Building
144 Wellington Street

Notes for media:

    • Open coverage
    • Media are asked to arrive no later than 5:30 p.m.
    • Accreditation from the Canadian Parliamentary Press Gallery is required. For more information, contact Pierre Cuguen at Pierre.Cuguen@parl.gc.ca          

7:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend the Canadian Electricity Association’s Annual Board of Directors and Corporate Partners Gala Dinner, and will deliver remarks.          

Canada North Room
National Arts Centre
1 Elgin Street

Notes for media:

    • Open coverage
    • Media are asked to arrive no later than 7:00 p.m.
